JP Hrisoulas, Col. NANG (ret)
Bladesmith, Metallographer, Researcher

-----Original Message-----
From: excelsiorilluminati <excelsiorilluminati@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sat, 29 Nov 2008 7:38 pm
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Question about a small Tanto or??






Gordon, Those who are in the Nihonto community are aware of who is who 
and it surprises me that someone who will not even identify themselves 
questions credentials of a giant in the field. Sometimes people 
speak/write without thought or research and may be forgiven, but, 
rudeness never. I hope you don't let it get to you. I asked in an 
earlier post for ID and was ignored and that leaves me cold. 
The "Unknown Polisher"? John

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, ROBSON Gordon <robsongo@...> wrote:
>
> The position of the mekugi ana and its shape are not of Japanese 
origins. I don't 
> need to read more books. As a member of the NTHK's shinsa team here 
in Tokyo 
> and a director of the NTHK, I would say that I am in a bit better 
position to know. If 
> that sword were submitted for shinsa, it would fail as not being 
Japanese.
> 
> Gordon
>
